Entries.default: "Greetings. I assume Thaenic explained our little floating trading floor, so I'll cut through the fat. I'm Sautara, purveyor of fine armors and weapons, whether for kith or ship."
"Let me see what you have."
[Leave] "Farewell."
"This is an unusual vessel."
"What are you in the market for?"
"How'd you end up on the Deck?"

"He is, isn't he? Looks like a junk now, but that's mostly my doing. Underneath the decades of patches and filth, there's some truly strange shit. Copper, adra, Aedyran runes, Vailian pipes." 

She shakes her head.

A broad-shouldered aumaua stands before crates and racks of armors and weapons. The cool tones of her skin and the geometric patterns in her oil-stained smock mark her as a native of Rauatai. She smiles at your approach, displaying her sharp teeth, and bows her head.
"Best guess is that he came out of old Engwith, modified over the millennia by whoever crewed him."
"I wanted to rename him the 'Junky Junk of Junk,' but Thaenic wouldn't have it."
"A question I ask myself often."
"Peruse at your pleasure."
"Fair seas and gods' speed."
"You seem to have a lagufaeth in the corner..."
"That's Bauble. Not particularly bright, but he can count coin well enough."
"Or she. I've never been sure, and I'm disinclined to check."
"Its name is Bauble?"
"That's what we call him. He likes things with a bit of shine to them."
"The ship's a 'him?'"
"Trust me on that. I know him inside and out."
"The simple version is that the Deck dropped anchor in Rauatai looking for a blacksmith. I was a blacksmith looking to get out of Rauatai."
"What's the less simple version?"
"Didn't know a bowline from a baleen at the time, but you learn fast at sea or you sink."
"Considerably more complicated and entirely none of your business."
